column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Check a Licensed Contractor in New York
#Text=In the state of New York , all contractors in the home improvement field must have a license as issued by the New York Department of State 's ( DOS ) Division of Consumer Protection .
#Text=Licensed contractors are required to have workers ' compensation insurance and have passed written examinations on contracting laws in addition to a criminal background check .
#Text=The benefit to checking a contractor 's license is that it protects you as a consumer in the event a contractor damages your home or refuses to finish the project you hired them for .

#Text=To check the status of a licensed contractor in New York City , you must consult with the New York Department of Consumer Affairs ( DCA ) ; however , if you are located anywhere else within the state of New York , you may consult directly with the New York DOS .
#Text=Continue reading this guide to learn about the methods you can use in New York State to check the validity of contractor 's licenses .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Checking a Contractor in New York City
#Text=Access the DCA " Instant License Check " tool .

column1: #Text=The New York DCA website allows you to search for contractors online and verify whether they have a license .
#Text=Go to the New York City government website provided to you in the Sources section of this article .
#Text=Scroll down on the website until you reach the " Quick Tips " section , then click on the link for " Instant License Check .

column1: #Text=Examine search results to locate the contractor .
#Text=If your contractor is licensed , their name or business will appear in the search results along with their address , contact information , and license number .
#Text=Verify the status of the contractor 's license .

#Text=Although a contractor is listed in the DCA database , you may want to consult the DCA to verify that the contractor 's license is active and has not been suspended or revoked due to unethical business practices .
#Text=Call the DCA by dialing 311 from anywhere within New York City and provide the DCA representative with the contractor 's name or license number .
#Text=You will then be given the complaint history and license status of a particular contractor 's license .
#Text=If you do not have Internet access , call the New York DCA at 311 from anywhere in New York City to obtain license details for a specific contractor .
#Text=Checking a Contractor in New York State
#Text=Consult with the New York DOS to check a contractor 's license .
#Text=The Division of Consumer Protection within the New York DOS can provide you with the status of a contractor 's license and their complaint history .
#Text=Call the Division of Consumer Protection at 1-518-474-8583 or 1-800-697-1220 between Monday and Friday to speak with a representative .

#Text=You may also fax your inquiry to 1-518-486-3936 or send a letter to : New York Department of State ( line 1 ) , Division of Consumer Protection ( line 2 ) , Consumer Assistance Unit ( line 3 ) , Alfred E. Smith Office Building ( line 4 ) , 80 South Swan Street ( line 5 ) , P.O. Box 22001 ( line 6 ) , Albany , New York 12201-2001 ( line 7 ) .
#Text=Provide information regarding your inquiry about the contractor to the DOS ; such as the contractor 's name , business name , address , or license number .
#Text=The DOS will then correspond with you regarding complaints and the status of the contractor 's license .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips

#Text=If you are located in New York City , and the licensed contractor you hired either refuses to finish working on your home , cannot be located , went out of business , or damaged your home , you can consult with the New York DCA , who may reimburse you a maximum of 15,000 dollars ( 11,249.44 euros ) for your loss .
